A much better foreign policy than TFG.

with older countries that are more tribal  or religiously driven, it simply takes longer.  generations not decades.... problem is people in more developed nations seem to be loosing much of their patience as time goes on, it's like we gotta go faster and faster, outpacing productivity but at the same time loosing much of what makes us who we are.   doing something fast doesn't mean you poured your heart and soul into it, it looses that sort of value.... the problem as always is that power corrupts, if you cannot get the safeguards in place to keep it in check, people will eventually abuse something of the system, typically for financial gain or influence.  with that corruption comes the desire to keep that power, and hence the safeguards fail and you end up with some form of dictatorship... or likewise.  there is the potential that afghanistan will evolve, but we can't just point at next year or the year after and say if they don't have everything we have, then there is something wrong.... because as i said, this is an older country and it is still very tribal / religious based... it will take generations.   if it becomes stable in my lifetime, i will be amazed, surprisingly so.  but also very proud of the chances they have, to step away from what they were.... not saying they'll become a flagship for any type of governance but a step in the right direction, even if i don't agree with much of what they do, is still a step closer for their people to have better lives.  after all that's the point.  not that they live their lives under my flag or anothers, but that they have good lives under their own flag, and are willing and able to foster peaceful relations with others, to join the world economy... or at least the continental/regional one.

Daily Reminder: William Krystol has STILL not apologized to the American people for being so aggregiously wrong in his approach (and that of his entire NeoCon cabal) under “Project For A New American Century” (PNAC) which gave us Perl, Rice, Cheney, Wolfowitz, Rumsfeld, etc for America to control/manipulate the Middle East via Iraq.
